docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to everyone who took part in today's EconoQuiz.
docs.abstract: Answers to our quiz on economics issues in the news -- and a winner.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Harwood of the New York Times and CNBC looks at the latest on health care reform and the protests against it. He also interviews The Times’ Paul Krugman on the “Republican Death Trip.”

headline.main: MSNBC: The New York Times Edition

docs.snippet: John Harwood of the New York Times and CNBC looks at the latest on health care reform and the protests against it. He also interviews The Times’ Paul Krugman on the “Republican Death Trip.”

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama holds a town hall in Belgrade, Mont., to explain the new health care bill.
docs.snippet: President Obama holds a town hall in Belgrade, Mont., to explain the new health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH -- Facing a skeptical audience of progressive/liberal bloggers and advocates, Senator Arlen Specter, the incumbent Republican-turned-Democrat of Pennsylvania, cited his positions on the economic stimulus, abortion rights, stem cell research and other issues as evidence that he represents their views.
docs.abstract: The incumbent senator and his challenger answer questions at the bloggers' conference in Pittsburgh.
docs.snippet: The incumbent senator and his challenger answer questions at the bloggers' conference in Pittsburgh.

docs.lead_paragraph: 4:11 | The town hall has ended. Mr. Stout's coverage is below.

headline.main: Live Blogging: Obama Hosts a Town Hall in Montana

docs.abstract: The president makes the case for an overhaul of health care at a town hall event in Montana.
docs.snippet: The president makes the case for an overhaul of health care at a town hall event in Montana.

docs.lead_paragraph: Theodore R. Marmor is professor emeritus of public policy and political science at Yale University and a former fellow of the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research. He is the author of "The Politics of Medicare" (Aldine Transaction, 2000). He spoke to freelance writer Sarah Arnquist.
docs.abstract: An expert overview of the health care system in Canada.
docs.snippet: An expert overview of the health care system in Canada.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated | 6:46 p.m. Responding to attacks on Britain's National Health Service by opponents of health insurance reform in the United States, British political leaders from the left and the right have taken to the airwaves, the blogwaves and the twitwaves to defend the government-run health care system known as the NHS.

headline.main: British Leaders Defend Their Health Service

docs.abstract: Responding to attacks on Britain's National Health Service by opponents of health insurance reform in the United States, British political leaders from the left and the right have taken to the airwaves, the blogwaves and the twitwaves to defend the government-run health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH -- At times fiery with his familiar finger-pointing repeatedly jabbing the air, former President Bill Clinton implored an audience of bloggers and activists tonight not to lose out on a moment that he said he had worked all his life for.

headline.main: Bill Clinton: The Time Is Now

docs.abstract: The former president seemed to convey that today's battles are as much about his legacy as they are tomorrow's.
docs.snippet: The former president seemed to convey that today's battles are as much about his legacy as they are tomorrow's.

headline.print_headline: Don’t Hurt the Health Care Clinics
